alert.note: Alert for Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 5:49PM CDT until July 04 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Kansas, including the following counties, Phillips and Smith. * WHEN...Until midnight CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 547 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cedar Creek, Beaver Creek, North Fork Solomon River, Crooked Creek, Bow Creek, Kirwin Reservoir Area, Lawrence Creek, Big Creek, Deer Creek, Medicine Creek, Plum Creek, Middle Beaver Creek, Turner Creek and Glen Rock Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kensington, Agra, Kirwin, Athol and Cedar.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
